titleStmt.title: S. J. Stowers et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Harrison County would most respectfully represent to his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky that at the November Term 1858 of the Harrison Circuit Court John Latare was convicted of Man Slaughter for killing William Dougan and by judgement of the court was ordered to be confined in the State penitentiary for the period of seven years He was shortly afterward taken to the penitentiary we feel fully assured that all the objects of the law the refermation of the prisoner being one of them have been fully obtained We would further represent that the father & Mother of the prisoner are in very destitute circumstances that they have no one else to look to for Support and that his assistance which we feel assured he would give which is nesesary to them We think there is no one acquainted with the facts but would willingly give his assent to the prisoners being released We ask your Excellency to Extend to him the Mercies of law and to release him from the remainder of his time

S. J Stowers P M
Jacob Boyers
B Thos Boyd J. P. H. C
Wesley Howard D. C. H. C
William M. Terry
Alonzo Lyter
J H Renneckar Juror
John D Renneckar Esq
W E Arthur late Atty for Com lth

Harrison Cir Ct
vs
John Latart

To his Excellency Thos E Bramlet
Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens fo Harrison County would most respectfully represent to his Excellency. Thomas E Bramlet Govenor of Kentucky that at the November term 1858 of the Harrison Circuit Court, John Latart, was convicted of man slaughter for killing William Dougan and by judgement of the court was orderd to be confined in the State penitentiary for the period of seven years he was shortly afterward taken to the penitentiary. we ful fully assured that all the objects of the law, the reformation of the Prisoner being one, of them, have been fully obtained. We would further represent that the father and Mother are in very destitute circumstances, that they have no one else to look to for support and that his assistance which we feel assured -- he would give is necessary to them we think there is no one acquainted with the facts but ^would^ willingly give his assent to the prisoners being released We ask your Excellency to extend to him the mercies of law, and to release him from the remainder of his time

Thos F Michael (juror)
George Adams Juror
R. J. Whiteker C. H. C
H H Haviland J. P. H. C
A P West (P M
B F Dills Juror
Jefferson Geoghagen (Juror)
Osar P Poindexter Juror
James J Tebbs Juror
